issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Task: CC to communicate failure to migrate to CLC (no resources or no capability) via CC service state error

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When I send a CLC a {{MigrateInstances}} request and it fails for some reason, it doesn't tell me why anywhere in its response.  I expect a human-readable error message in either an AWS-compatible {{Message}} element or a Eucalyptus-specific {{statusMessage}} element.

I also expect a non-200 HTTP code, but we've already covered that in EUCA-5269.

Here's an example of the response I get for bad input:

{noformat}
gholms@luna ~ % bin/euca-migrate-instances --source-host 0.0.0.0 --debug
2013-03-11 14:19:50,742 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:request_params: {'SourceHost': '0.0.0.0'}
2013-03-11 14:19:50,743 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Method: GET
2013-03-11 14:19:50,743 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Eucalyptus/
2013-03-11 14:19:50,743 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Data: 
2013-03-11 14:19:50,743 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Headers: {}
2013-03-11 14:19:50,743 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Host: 10.111.1.56:8773
2013-03-11 14:19:50,743 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={}
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Token: None
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:using _calc_signature_2
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:query string: AWSAccessKeyId=BSECKVETF314SHWYIMUWR&Action=MigrateInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&SourceHost=0.0.0.0&Timestamp=2013-03-11T21%3A19%3A50Z&Version=eucalyptus
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: GET
10.111.1.56:8773
/services/Eucalyptus/
AWSAccessKeyId=BSECKVETF314SHWYIMUWR&Action=MigrateInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&SourceHost=0.0.0.0&Timestamp=2013-03-11T21%3A19%3A50Z&Version=eucalyptus
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:len(b64)=44
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:base64 encoded digest: liu0XqTummlvs8TYtEWQrxGlCF78Y+aia1vwvxj4U6s=
2013-03-11 14:19:50,744 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:query_string: AWSAccessKeyId=BSECKVETF314SHWYIMUWR&Action=MigrateInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&SourceHost=0.0.0.0&Timestamp=2013-03-11T21%3A19%3A50Z&Version=eucalyptus Signature: liu0XqTummlvs8TYtEWQrxGlCF78Y+aia1vwvxj4U6s=
2013-03-11 14:19:50,803 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:<euca:MigrateInstancesResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com/3.2.1"><euca:CloudTopologyMessage><euca:EucalyptusMessage><euca:_return>false</euca:_return><euca:_services/><euca:_disabledServices/><euca:_notreadyServices/></euca:EucalyptusMessage></euca:CloudTopologyMessage></euca:MigrateInstancesResponseType>
error: failed to start migration
{noformat}

For ease of reading, here is a formatted version of the server's response:
{code:xml}
<euca:MigrateInstancesResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com/3.2.1">
    <euca:CloudTopologyMessage>
        <euca:EucalyptusMessage>
            <euca:_return>false</euca:_return>
            <euca:_services/>
            <euca:_disabledServices/>
            <euca:_notreadyServices/>
        </euca:EucalyptusMessage>
    </euca:CloudTopologyMessage>
</euca:MigrateInstancesResponseType>
{code}

Here's what I get for one that actually works, but errors out anyway because of EUCA-5343:
{noformat}
gholms@luna ~ % bin/euca-migrate-instances --source-host 10.111.1.62 --debug
2013-03-11 13:40:38,123 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:request_params: {'SourceHost': '10.111.1.62'}
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Method: GET
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Eucalyptus/
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Data: 
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Headers: {}
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Host: 10.111.1.56:8773
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={}
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:Token: None
2013-03-11 13:40:38,124 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:using _calc_signature_2
2013-03-11 13:40:38,125 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:query string: AWSAccessKeyId=BSECKVETF314SHWYIMUWR&Action=MigrateInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&SourceHost=10.111.1.62&Timestamp=2013-03-11T20%3A40%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus
2013-03-11 13:40:38,125 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: GET
10.111.1.56:8773
/services/Eucalyptus/
AWSAccessKeyId=BSECKVETF314SHWYIMUWR&Action=MigrateInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&SourceHost=10.111.1.62&Timestamp=2013-03-11T20%3A40%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus
2013-03-11 13:40:38,125 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:len(b64)=44
2013-03-11 13:40:38,125 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:base64 encoded digest: PuU0DiiphKfsFsWebTE3tQe9xEBRUH8VxUBhAHY/3Ps=
2013-03-11 13:40:38,125 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:query_string: AWSAccessKeyId=BSECKVETF314SHWYIMUWR&Action=MigrateInstances&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&SourceHost=10.111.1.62&Timestamp=2013-03-11T20%3A40%3A38Z&Version=eucalyptus Signature: PuU0DiiphKfsFsWebTE3tQe9xEBRUH8VxUBhAHY/3Ps=
2013-03-11 13:41:38,295 MigrateInstances [DEBUG]:<euca:MigrateInstancesResponseType xmlns:euca="http://msgs.eucalyptus.com/3.2.1"><euca:CloudTopologyMessage><euca:EucalyptusMessage><euca:_return>false</euca:_return><euca:_services/><euca:_disabledServices/><euca:_notreadyServices/></euca:EucalyptusMessage></euca:CloudTopologyMessage></euca:MigrateInstancesResponseType>
error: failed to start migration
{noformat}
fields.summary: Failed migration starts don't say why they failed

comments.body: Passing to Chris, so he can add status propagation from CC to CLC.

Updated w/ error handling.  Last case shown is an error propagated back from the CC.

Branch is {{dev/grze/EUCA-5344}}.

{code}
[root@c-04 clc]# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-E771458A	885292932687
INSTANCE	i-FDCA3F8F	emi-FA00358A	1.103.32.218	1.103.32.218	terminated		0		m1.small	2013-04-25T07:18:31.605Z	PARTI00	eki-4F433AC2	eri-CD263CFE		monitoring-disabled	1.103.32.218	1.103.32.218			instance-store									
RESERVATION	r-6AC14041	885292932687	default
INSTANCE	i-4C5F42AC	emi-FA00358A	10.111.101.125	1.103.32.220	running		0		m1.small	2013-04-25T07:10:41.862Z	PARTI00	eki-4F433AC2	eri-CD263CFE		monitoring-disabled	10.111.101.125	1.103.32.220			instance-store									
TAG	instance	i-4C5F42AC	euca:node	10.111.1.40
[root@c-04 clc]# euca-migrate-instances -i i-FDCA3F8F
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Cannot migrate a terminated instance: i-FDCA3F8F
[root@c-04 clc]# euca-terminate-instances  i-FDCA3F8F
INSTANCE	i-FDCA3F8F	terminated	terminated
[root@c-04 clc]# euca-migrate-instances  --source 10.111.1.401 
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.1.401
[root@c-04 clc]# euca-migrate-instances  --source 10.111.1.40
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Migrating off of node 10.111.1.40 failed because of: ERROR
{code}

commit 3269ed827db957bdce4d692af28dc4feadd8e0c2
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 24 22:31:12 2013 -0700

    Fix to error check/handling in migration
    
    - Fix checking for node before migration
    - Fix checking for ENABLED cluster before migration
    - Fix checking for instance before migration
    - Fix error propagation for CC error responses
    
    Fixes EUCA-5344 and EUCA-5269
Errors should now propagate correctly to the client tools; again see [~gholms] for details.

migration on an empty host: {noformat} [root@b-12 ~]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.28 Error(MigrateInstancesType): Migrating off of node 10.111.5.28 failed because of: no instances running on the host {noformat} restarted CC and tried to migrate instance: - first attempt {noformat} [root@b-12 ~]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.40 Error(MigrateInstancesType): Migrating off of node 10.111.5.40 failed because of: Failed to request migration in the zone PARTI00 because updating resources returned an error: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No transition to PENDING from current state State:name=arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_69/:state=ENABLED:mark=false:transition=idle. Let me know if any more information is needed.
I'm sure there are plenty, but the fact that errors are actually getting propagated to the command line is good enough for me.  We can file bugs about specific problems later.
